columns.name: cluster_identifier
columns.description: The unique identifier of the cluster.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the cluster.

columns.name: cluster_namespace_arn
columns.description: The namespace Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.

columns.name: allow_version_upgrade
columns.description: A boolean value that, if true, indicates that major version upgrades will be applied automatically to the cluster during the maintenance window.

columns.name: automated_snapshot_retention_period
columns.description: The number of days that automatic cluster snapshots are retained.

columns.name: availability_zone
columns.description: The name of the Availability Zone in which the cluster is located.

columns.name: availability_zone_relocation_status
columns.description: Describes the status of the Availability Zone relocation operation.

columns.name: cluster_availability_status
columns.description: The availability status of the cluster for queries.

columns.name: cluster_create_time
columns.description: The date and time that the cluster was created.

columns.name: cluster_nodes
columns.description: The nodes in the cluster.

columns.name: cluster_parameter_groups
columns.description: The list of cluster parameter groups that are associated with this cluster. Each parameter group in the list is returned with its status.

columns.name: cluster_public_key
columns.description: The public key for the cluster.

columns.name: cluster_revision_number
columns.description: The specific revision number of the database in the cluster.

columns.name: cluster_security_groups
columns.description: A list of cluster security group that are associated with the cluster. Each security group is represented by an element that contains ClusterSecurityGroup.Name and ClusterSecurityGroup.Status subelements. Cluster security groups are used when the cluster is not created in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC). Clusters that are created in a VPC use VPC security groups, which are listed by the VpcSecurityGroups parameter.

columns.name: cluster_snapshot_copy_status
columns.description: A value that returns the destination region and retention period that are configured for cross-region snapshot copy.

columns.name: cluster_status
columns.description: The current state of the cluster.

columns.name: cluster_subnet_group_name
columns.description: The name of the subnet group that is associated with the cluster. This parameter is valid only when the cluster is in a VPC.

columns.name: cluster_version
columns.description: The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the cluster.

columns.name: data_transfer_progress
columns.description: Describes the status of a cluster while it is in the process of resizing with an incremental resize.

columns.name: db_name
columns.description: The name of the initial database that was created when the cluster was created. This same name is returned for the life of the cluster. If an initial database was not specified, a database named devdev was created by default.

columns.name: deferred_maintenance_windows
columns.description: Describes a group of DeferredMaintenanceWindow objects.

columns.name: elastic_ip_status
columns.description: The status of the elastic IP (EIP) address.

columns.name: elastic_resize_number_of_node_options
columns.description: The number of nodes that you can resize the cluster to with the elastic resize method.

columns.name: encrypted
columns.description: A boolean value that, if true, indicates that data in the cluster is encrypted at rest.

columns.name: endpoint
columns.description: The connection endpoint.

columns.name: enhanced_vpc_routing
columns.description: An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. If this option is true, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.

columns.name: expected_next_snapshot_schedule_time
columns.description: The date and time when the next snapshot is expected to be taken for clusters with a valid snapshot schedule and backups enabled.

columns.name: expected_next_snapshot_schedule_time_status
columns.description: The status of next expected snapshot for clusters having a valid snapshot schedule and backups enabled.

columns.name: hsm_status
columns.description: A value that reports whether the Amazon Redshift cluster has finished applying any hardware security module (HSM) settings changes specified in a modify cluster command.

columns.name: iam_roles
columns.description: A list of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used by the cluster to access other AWS services.

columns.name: kms_key_id
columns.description: The AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key ID of the encryption key used to encrypt data in the cluster.

columns.name: maintenance_track_name
columns.description: The name of the maintenance track for the cluster.

columns.name: manual_snapshot_retention_period
columns.description: The default number of days to retain a manual snapshot. If the value is -1, the snapshot is retained indefinitely. This setting doesn't change the retention period of existing snapshots. The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.

columns.name: master_username
columns.description: The master user name for the cluster. This name is used to connect to the database that is specified in the DBName parameter.

columns.name: modify_status
columns.description: The status of a modify operation, if any, initiated for the cluster.

columns.name: next_maintenance_window_start_time
columns.description: The date and time in UTC when system maintenance can begin.

columns.name: node_type
columns.description: The node type for the nodes in the cluster.

columns.name: number_of_nodes
columns.description: The number of compute nodes in the cluster.

columns.name: pending_actions
columns.description: Cluster operations that are waiting to be started.

columns.name: pending_modified_values
columns.description: A value that, if present, indicates that changes to the cluster are pending. Specific pending changes are identified by subelements.

columns.name: preferred_maintenance_window
columns.description: The weekly time range, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC), during which system maintenance can occur.

columns.name: publicly_accessible
columns.description: A boolean value that, if true, indicates that the cluster can be accessed from a public network.

columns.name: resize_info
columns.description: Describes a resize operation.

columns.name: restore_status
columns.description: A value that describes the status of a cluster restore action. This parameter returns null if the cluster was not created by restoring a snapshot.

columns.name: snapshot_schedule_identifier
columns.description: A unique identifier for the cluster snapshot schedule.

columns.name: snapshot_schedule_state
columns.description: The current state of the cluster snapshot schedule.

columns.name: vpc_id
columns.description: The identifier of the VPC the cluster is in, if the cluster is in a VPC.

columns.name: vpc_security_groups
columns.description: A list of Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) security groups that are associated with the cluster. This parameter is returned only if the cluster is in a VPC.

columns.name: logging_status
columns.description: Describes the status of logging for a cluster.

columns.name: scheduled_actions
columns.description: A list of scheduled actions for specified cluster.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: The list of tags for the cluster.
